page.title: 12NATLAND MILL BECK FARM.
page.content: { Natland Mill Beck Farm}is at least 308 years old and possibly older says Mrs. Gardner, the owner. The farm has been in the family thirty-two years. It covers 167 acres but some of the land is situated elsewhere. There are about eighty-five{cows}including sterks and heifers. They are mainly {Friesian,}although some{Holsteins}have been introduced. These dairy cows each give about 27.5 litres of{milk}a day, or up to 45 litres in lactation. The milk goes to Dairy Crest and the Milk Marketing Board to be bottled or made into{yoghurt, butter, cheese or {skimmed milk. There are four{tractors}and a{plough among the twenty-four items in use on the farm. Natland Mill Beck Farm produces its own silage and uses approximately 110 tons of feed cake a year.
